name: Two Seam Cube
description: Small knitted cubes, only 2.5” tall. These make great baby toys and they really do only have two sewn seams.
full_text: Small knitted cubes, only 2.5” tall. These make great baby toys and they really do only have two sewn seams. For an ADVANCED BEGINNER Knitter, the cubes are partly knitted in the round on double pointed needles and there is some picking up stitches. WHERE IS THE PATTERN? You’ll find the pattern on the Natty Knitter blog in the green sidebar on the right hand side. Click on the image in that sidebar and it will take you to the PDF. If you’re browsing from a cellphone, scroll down through the blog entries and the free patterns are at the bottom of the page. SKILLS REQUIRED Knit Purl Knitting in the round on double pointed needles PU stitches MATERIALS REQUIRED Approx 40 yards of Double Knitting yarn Scrap of contrasting color yarn to mark stitches with US size 3 (3 ¼ mm) double pointed needles or size needed to obtain gauge Tapestry Needle Handful of fiberfill (stuffing) HINTS AND TIPS to help you with this pattern are available on my blog http://nattyknitter.wordpress.com this is mentioned in the pattern.
